website_summaries.verdict: While the low price might seem to be good to be true, this is a safe and quality set of quickdraws.
pros: Incredibly low price for good quickdraws
They're lightweight which makes them good for trad climbing
Many owners have taken falls on them and have had no issues with the quickdraws holding
cons: On the smaller side which can make it more difficult to clip line into

customer_reviews.title: look great.
customer_reviews.text: they seem like great draws, and for a great price. the price kind of had me worried that they would be sub-par, but they do look very well made and put together, just as good as my black diamonds. however, i havent actually used them yet. so if this is my last review and im never heard from again, please change to 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Zanella

customer_reviews.title: The best value quickdraws
customer_reviews.text: The best value quickdraws. Also, both orange and grey carabiners are identical in shape, so I don't have to worry about which one goes to the wall and which one to the rope (bent gate = rope and straight gate = wall). Only bad thing about those are, they are a bit small and are little ackward to clip in, but since I'm not a professional climber, it doesn't really matter if I have the best equipment or not. Perfectly fine quick draws for a hobbist climber
customer_reviews.author: J.B.L.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these quickdraws, I had previously tried 2 others before landing on this set
customer_reviews.text: Having tried two others 1 was heavy and too uncomfortable the other was light but still uncomfortable. This set is LIGHT and VERY COMFORTABLE to use even with my big hands. They are long enough to place on our outdoor training wall, make sure you secure them well and according to the weight/force they're going to pull, the draw won't brake but that's not the weak point here, it's the connection to the wall/rock.
customer_reviews.author: Bugalydosh

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but good things to say
customer_reviews.text: Light, strong, and well designed; these are a pleasure to clip and handle. Two things to consider before buying these though. They are a little smaller than some other draws, so if you have large hands and you're used to larger draws, you might not like these. Also, as with other wire draws, the gate can snag lightly on your rope as you're cleaning a route. If that's a big deal to you, solid gate quick draws might be a better option.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: perfect for begginners and people needing extra draws for those fidget spinners.
customer_reviews.text: I've used these on 5.8 all the way to 5.12 and they work great. They are so cheap and affordable with a great quality that is fitting of an expensive set that there is no reason to pass this deal up. I've had some big falls and there is still no sign of issues. TIP!!! Sometimes they go below the price of 59.99 bucks. grab them at that price. The normal price is still great but buying it for 10 bucks less is great too.
customer_reviews.author: LocoLogan

customer_reviews.title: Good for hammocks 👍🏽👍🏽
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t use these for climbing* but they rock for hammocks!!️ This is the second set we’ve bought for hammocks bc they used to be way cheaper as the colors are backwards of what you’d want in a quick draw but who cares with a hammock. *I would consider purchasing a higher quality brand for your actual climbing quick draws but these are rad for around the house use.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: They worked great, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Some friends and I purchased a few sets of these quickdraws for a climbing trip to Red River Gorge Kentucky. They worked great, lightweight, easy to clip and seemed very durable. The only con I could find with these draws if any were that they were pretty short. They would have been tough to use to directly clip in to an anchor, however if you have a PAS and don't plan on using them for this reason they are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Sager

customer_reviews.title: Great quickdraws at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 200lbs. and I've taken two falls over 6ft with these since I've purchased them. I have full confidence in these quickdraws. I'd definitely recommend them for sport climbing.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Stronger rating than BD
customer_reviews.text: The biners are rated greater than my buddies BD draws and are lighter and cheaper to boot. Took a good fall this weekend (controlled test) and I'm not dead. Will buy another set when the need arises. Best value for $ that I've seen on draws yet! Plus the colors are fiaaaaa
customer_reviews.author: slimguy

customer_reviews.title: ... did very well with these and the price is amazing. You can find better draws
customer_reviews.text: Five stars because Mad Rock did very well with these and the price is amazing. You can find better draws. But, you will not find a cheaper set of quality draws. I actually got these on sale for $45/per 6. They are light, certified strong, and clipping is very smooth. I would highly recommend to anyone and I will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bargain for excellent draws (at $59)
customer_reviews.text: To alleviate standard concerns: - yes, these are real draws (don't let the price fool you) - they are very light - the gates are typical width and open without difficulty - After a few months of use, the only thing I find challenging about them is when removing a rope under tension.. as with most draws of this design, the tooth at the end of the gate catches on the rope. It is not anything specific to this particular draw, but still worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: LocalShopper

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy
customer_reviews.text: definitively a good buy. the clip is soft enought for you to clip/unclip and the ties seem strong (haven't fall yet) the finishes are pretty neat. I read somewhere that they weighted a bit but it's not true. They are the lightest of all the quickdraws we have from several brands. Nice buy, go get yours.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Rush

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: 12 carabiners and 6 dog bones, can't beat that deal. Strength rating is the same as more expensive sets, the biners are heavy but the bones are light. I’ve bought 5 sets just for the biners. Recently switched to lighter ones
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Snag these while you can, the price is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the price scare you. These are very sturdy and trustworthy. I've already taken a few falls on them. I actually prefer using these quickdraws to the Black Diamond ones. The Mad Rock quickdraws feel lighter and easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: S W

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were very inexpensive. I really love them, no complaints, and a great price
customer_reviews.author: JKruse

customer_reviews.title: Light and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Awesome draws to add to a growing rack. I carry them with my trad rack (lighter than my Petzl Spirits), and when I need extra draws for my sport rack (Portrero).
customer_reviews.author: CJB

customer_reviews.title: Great in general-especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: 5 Stars, not even just for the price (60 bucks for 6). These are great Quickdraws. There's really no reason to pay twice as much for ones that look a bit cooler in my opinion. Would definitely buy again I think the material part is called the dogbone? It's the weakest part of the draw and it's tested up to 22Kn, so this is quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... trip to Thailand with some friends and was very happy with how they stacked up against my friends draws
customer_reviews.text: I bought these prior to a climbing trip to Thailand with some friends and was very happy with how they stacked up against my friends draws. The Concorde draws are very very light weight and have a nice smooth action. I really couldn't have asked for better, especially not for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and works
customer_reviews.text: Works well for indoor climbing. Because of the light feel some may question build quality, but have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: vujade

customer_reviews.title: Great value and even lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Mad Rock makes good products that are very affordable. I like these quickdraws and will probably buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: strong and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've used these quick-draws multiple times for lead climbing and setting up a quick top rope. they work well and are reliable. definitely worth the cost as you don't want to buy cheap gear that is essentially your life line but still cheaper than some other options i've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Dillan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quickdraws for the price. 2 seasons in and no issue thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints with the Mad Rock Concorde Quickdraw Set I think the price is fair
customer_reviews.author: Eric benscoter

customer_reviews.title: well made and feel nice in the hand
customer_reviews.text: Light, well made and feel nice in the hand. I don't love the hook nose, that's hardly a deal killer and is common enough not to blame Mad Rock for it. At $10 apiece, these things are hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: pookey

customer_reviews.title: Fair Price for a great quickdraw
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome quickdraws and at a fair price! They came exactly as pictured and I've always thought mad rock to be reliable and they kept those thoughts alive with these quickdraws.
customer_reviews.author: Troy A

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for an excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for an excellent price! I really like that the carabiners are different colors. It makes it easy to identify which one to put on the wall. Also, the hook is easier than most to hook the rope on.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Great draws!
customer_reviews.text: Used these on our first trip to Red River Gorge. No problems at all!
customer_reviews.author: B. Foley

customer_reviews.title: Held a lead fall fine; Draws are good yet small
customer_reviews.text: Held a lead fall about 2 meters above the bolt. Very good. Only gripe I have is that they're a bit small.
customer_reviews.author: E. Borders

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, exactly what was promised in description
customer_reviews.text: Recieved a day early, great quality good push resistance on the clips, not too hard and not too easy.
customer_reviews.author: RACHAEL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice draws you can switch the orange to the rope side so it doesn't confuse you!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Reilly

customer_reviews.title: I didn't die!
customer_reviews.text: They work great! I survived my first climbing weekend with them this past weekend and they are doing great. Definitely a good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: They are not as solid-feeling as other quickdraws I have, and they could have been slightly bigger, but they are very light and absolutely great for the price
customer_reviews.author: shayel k.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these quick draws! The clip is easy to use and has not failed me. I highly suggest this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great value, good carabiners
customer_reviews.text: I love this quickdraw set. I separate most of them and use them as individual carabiners, and it's a very good value. The orange is a pleasing, easy to find color. The shape is comfortable in the hand. The latch quick and deliberately.
customer_reviews.author: Mido

customer_reviews.title: Like em
customer_reviews.text: These have been great so far. Havent taken a whipper on them yet..
customer_reviews.author: Curtis hubble

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price for wire clips. Nice color too. I'd recommend these as a first set of quick draws.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Strong and light
customer_reviews.text: I've used them several times now and they're great. Wire gate is easy to manipulate and get a rope through.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: excellent price and performance
customer_reviews.text: Nice, a little smaller than my black diamond freewire, but a solid performer. Really like how well the rubber keeps the carbiner in place for clipping. Good set at a great price, and really light and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Tim N.

customer_reviews.title: Careful not to cross-load this sucker!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The price is great The draws certainly hold their weight They're compact Cons: The gates flip upside down a lot. Since there is no rubber stopper on the end of the draw, the carabiner has the ability to easily slide around in the draw loop. This could cause your gate to flip, giving you a hard time clipping or cleaning, or even worse, you could cross-load your quickdraw.
customer_reviews.author: Joel B.

customer_reviews.title: I like 'em
customer_reviews.text: They do the job and they're easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: bass_and_bass

customer_reviews.title: Haven't fallen yet
customer_reviews.text: Hello my fellow climbers. I have yet to have had a fall with these, but every other aspect works fine. Latches latch, it's not difficult to latch in, and I don't find 12 of these guys weighing me down.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Keller II

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very good, cheap and lasts longer. Easier to use. I like the color coding, easier to clip compared to my old one's. It's become standard these days though to color code
customer_reviews.author: chanakya

customer_reviews.title: Excellent draws
customer_reviews.text: Excellent draws, strong gate, already taken several falls on these sport climbing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Came in time and were perfect for us
customer_reviews.text: Bought these literally a few days before a joshua tree trip. Came in time and were perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Great price. They are very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great price. They are very lightweight, which can make them hard to grasp, especially if you hands are big.
customer_reviews.author: Alison McLennan

customer_reviews.title: awesome draws, great buy
customer_reviews.text: Really like the rope clipping action of the bent wire gates. Lighter than my buddies black diamond draws and it's easy to remember to clip the orange biner into the bolt.
customer_reviews.author: fballard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This quickdraw set is simply awesome - light and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Taras Oleksyn

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I wish the gate/beanier was slightly larger. Can't beat the price. I like the Camp USA photon beanier it's the right size
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Super light and solid clipping. Dont bother to pay more for black diamond or petzl when these do the same.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: I love my badass quickdraws!
customer_reviews.text: Can't find any quickdraws as great as these. Light, inexpensive, durable and most importantly safe. I've used couple of Petzl, BD and, although these are cheaper, they feel on a way different level up there with the 2015 Lightweight Petzl Ange Finesse. Anyone who is looking for a great 6 PACK! it's not even 5 like some others, but a SIX PACK should totally get these!
customer_reviews.author: Fed

customer_reviews.title: Quick Delivery, Solid Product, Good Price
customer_reviews.text: All three things are true. I like the value with this set, 6 Quickdraws for a great price! I could not find a better value.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Joyner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm still alive so these must be doing their job well!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Tran

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and price product. Easy and convenient to use when lead climbing. Would buy them again in future for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Beata

customer_reviews.title: Perfect intro set
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. I like the short draw aspect of them. Strong and leave me feeling confident clipping into them.
customer_reviews.author: MattyL

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time for a long sport climb we were heading to do. I was looking for some cheap draws for about 8 pitches of simulclimbing followed by 16 more pitches of steeper stuff. I was surprised when I got these on the quality. The webbing is light and the binners are great. Mad Rock continues to deliver great stuff at good prices.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Benning

customer_reviews.title: Serious design flaw!
customer_reviews.text: After buying a dozen of these a couple years ago I was pleased with the quality and price. However, I would not now recommend them after using them for a while; out of 12 draws, the rubber grommet that holds the rope end 'biner has broken in seven of them. This is with only very light use. Once they break there is no real fix, other than to cut off the rubber and use tape to secure the biner. Serious design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome R. Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: They do what they're supposed to do. I've had ...
customer_reviews.text: They do what they're supposed to do. I've had no problems with their mechanics or durability. The item description says anything else you need to know.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but will work
customer_reviews.text: For this price, I believe it was a fair purchase, but if you examine them carefully will notice that they're not as perfect as others. But I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mateus

customer_reviews.title: Life Proof
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, you can trust them with your life. I use these for outdoor sport climbing and have had them for about a year and they work great. Also an amazing price for 6 draws.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah F

customer_reviews.title: Great product and priced right
customer_reviews.text: These quickness are very nice. Well made and the price is right. Climbers need lots of gear. I will eventually get 2 more sets to add to my climbing rack.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Rask

customer_reviews.title: Great QuickDraw / Carabiner Pkg
customer_reviews.text: These are superb carabiners and quick draws. Unfortunately Amazon prime delivery times suck these days due to the coronavirus products taking priority over everything. I started to order from other vendors because I’m getting things much faster now then if I order on prime. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Archery

product_meta.title: Mad Rock Concorde Quickdraw Set
product_meta.description: FEATURES of the Mad Rock Concorde Quickdraw Set 6 pack of Concorde quick draws Warm forged aluminum carabiners Dyneema sling Strong and lightweight

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
